New Records: LeBron James' four-game triple-double streak came to an end
Dalton Knecht set a career-high 27 points in a spot start for the Lakers
Key Match Events: LeBron James responded with consecutive 3s to put the Lakers up 101-97 with 37 seconds left after a clutch 3 by Brandon Ingram gave the Pelicans a late two-point lead
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers were without Cam Reddish due to a lower right leg injury
The Pelicans were without Trey Murphy III due to a preseason hamstring injury
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis praised his team's effort in extending their winning streak to five games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers outscored the Pelicans in the paint, 52-40
The Pelicans have lost 10 of their last 12 games
Others: The Lakers return to NBA Cup action at home against Utah on Tuesday night, the same night the Pelicans also resume NBA Cup group play at Dallas
